author: gcolvin
content:
Hi Hugo.  We've been discussing this a fair amount here -- https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/706868829900505180/849090944325124136.

My take is that the overall 20% overhead you find is probably not acceptable, that some (how many?) contracts will be slowed down a lot more than that, and that the added complexity of EVM implementations would be rather unfortunate.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: we're seeing `eth_gasPrice` return `0x0` at lot today, anyone else seeing anything similar?  Trying to determine if it's a issue with the node being unstable or the GPO itself.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: actually I think it's an issue on our end, looks we are routing that RPC to some nodes without the recent GPO optimizations for some reason.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: ^ FWIW any geth nodes without Greg's GPO tweak or my `gpo.ignoreprice` option will be seeing lots of `0x0` gas estimates today, other clients might want to check what their `eth_gasPrice` has been returning too.

author: hugo_delacruz
content: thanks, I'm looking at the conversation there, yes the ~20% overhead is significant, the document is not considering this other impact on EVM performance which is something that also needs to be discussed
